titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 585: Ristretto circa li delitti piu frequenti à giudicarsi nel Sant' Officio

notesStmt.note: Title for manuscript from decorated title page for predominant work (p. iii).
See also UPenn Ms. Codex 573 and Ms. Codex 575 which have chapter headings similar to these.
Notes on p. ii are in the hand of Henry Charles Lea.

msContents.summary: Selections from a manual for inquisitors, followed by procedures (regole) for legal matters (cause) before the Inquisition.

msItem.title: Ristretto circa li delitti piu frequenti à giudicarsi nel Sant' Officio

supportDesc.extent: 97 leaves : 162 x 115 (117 x 76) mm. bound to 168 x 119 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper ii (modern paper) + 97 + ii (modern paper); [iv], 1-67, 67-129, [ii], 130-178, [ix]; contemporary pagination in ink, upper outer corners, modern pagination in pencil, upper right rectos of some leaves.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Three initials decorated in yellow, red, and blue, paint (p. 1, 92, and 110); title (p. iii), headings, and initials in red, yellow, and blue throughout.

origin.p: Written in Italy, ca. 1600 (Zacour-Hirsch); a reference to Cardinale Albici (Francesco Albizzi, elevated to Cardinal in 1654?) suggests a date in the second half of the 17th century.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Giuseppe Renato Imperiali, after his elevation to Cardinal in 1690 (stamp, Ex bibl. Ios. Ren[ato] Card. Imperialis, p. iii).
Formerly owned by Henry Charles Lea (signature, p. i).
Passed to the University with the library of Henry Charles Lea, 1909.
